CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 18, 1964, pg. 7 reads: "Dynamic Danettes - Members of the Dynamic Danettes Civic Club of Pittsburgh smile happily as they display their life membership plaques in NAACP. The plaques, totaling $4,500, were presented to them at a "Presentation Ball" last Sunday, at the Holiday House, by Morris DeLisser of the national NAACP, in New York.  Left to right: Dee C. Woodfork, Gladys Lawson, Florence Henderson, ball chairman; Atty. Henry Smith Jr., state NAACP president; Margaret Nelson; Mr. DeLisser, national life membership chairman; Ida Jones, president of the Danettes; Atty. Byrd R. Brown, president, Pittsburgh NAACP; Gladys Brown, Martha Loper, Jessie Grogan and Betty Culberson.-Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Members of Dynamic Danettes Civic Club of Pittsburgh holding NAACP life membership plaques, from left: Dee C. Woodfork, Gladys Lawson, Florence Henderson, Margaret Nelson, Ida Jones, Gladys Brown, Martha Loper, Jessie Grogan, Betty Culberson; and  men: Atty. Henry Smith Jr., Morris DeLisser, and Atty. Byrd R. Brown, in Holiday House for Presentation Ball
